comment: Honestly, it was such an easy class. There are a few exams (not on lockdown) from course readings that weren't too bad. There are also 4 essays in total, and they were easy to knock out really quickly. There are weekly discussions, and she is a very lenient grader, so as long as you complete the work and follow directions, you should get an easy A.

This was a pretty easy class, and she gave clear instructions. There were weekly discussion posts, and 3 essays on books that we had to read. There were 2 tests and 1 final paper. She gives good feedback and grades things quickly. She also sent out weekly announcements which was helpful. Pretty manageable class!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Legit best teacher ever. I wish all my teachers are like her! Just do your self a favor and pick her as your teacher!!

Honestly, I did not attend many of the lectures, but the ones i went to were fun. She is a lively person and does a great job of teaching the content. She is very real and understanding with grading and attendance. The tests /quizzes were easy, and if you keep up with the course, you will receive a high grade. I would 100% take this class again.

Really easy class. There are 6 quizzes, all of which can be found on quizlet. There are a few assignments & projects, but none of them took me over an hour to complete, and she's an easy grader (received 100% on all the assignments/projects with minimal effort). One short presentation at the end of the semester (5 minutes or less).

10/10 very easy class. I took it online & each week alternates between discussions & short written assignments with a quiz every other week ( all of the answers are on quizlet ). She responds to emails and is usually forgiving with grades and make up assignments if you have a real reason & communicate with her.

She was by far one of the best professors Ive had at KSU. You can tell that she cared about her students and the grades they earn. She is very quick with responding to emails and was really lenient with helping students during the pandemic. She made the class fun which was easy for me to enjoy coming to the class. 10/10.

Professor is caring, understanding, precise and wants you to do well in her class. She doesn't know how you feel until you open up to her. She has a great open door policy and welcomes everyone. I would take her again, she is one of the BEST sociology professionals at KSU.

She's far from being a bad professor, but she's also not my favorite so far. She is amazing though at providing feedback and is clear about her grading guidelines. She assigns two different discussion assignments weekly, but if you can get over the busy work from that, then you're golden. Pretty easy class to pass so long as you do your reading!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Although the class was online, she made the class vey easy to understand. I would take her again! She gives great feedback!

This was a great class. There was one assignment due every week and a quiz every two modules. The only material required for this class was a textbook, which was online and it was also free. The quizzes were pretty easy and she was an easy grader on the assignments, which were also pretty easy. I would definitely take this class again.

Such an easy class! Just did a discussion post or a short writing assignment each week and that was it! Short easy quizzes and test every few weeks. Such as laid back class and professor. Would definitely recommend her!

This professor is the best! She is so understanding and is willing to fix grades and give extra opportunities to boost grades. Textbook is online and free, cause she cares. If youre going to take any sociology class, take this one with this professor. You wont regret it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: She is the funniest professor I've ever had. She teaches you exactly what you need to know without giving too much detail because she knows its an intro class. She makes lectures fun and lets you out early 90% of the time. Tests are easy as long as you pay attention and she tells you specifics that will be on the test.

Amazing professor! I love her so much. She makes her lectures interesting and her written assignments/discussion posts aren't hard at all. And she gives great feedback on all assignments! The quizzes and projects she assigns are not difficult and honestly interesting and enjoyable! Please take her class, you wont regret it (:

Loved this class. Youll have discussion posts, written assignments, and a few projects. She isnt a harsh grader at all, and she gives great feedback on all assignments. You can tell that she really enjoys what she does.
The easiest A ever. Her lectures are so fun and simple. All of the assignments are easy and fair. It would be hard to fail this class. Please take this class!

Professor Laquanda's night classes are hilarious! Her lectures are short and leaves room for open discussion. You won't need the textbook, but her quizzes are a little difficult. GO TO THE HUMAN RIGHTS MUSEUM INSTEAD OF TAKING THE FINAL! It is a great experience and you write a page about it and you won't have to worry studying for another final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Best professor Ive had. Academic wise, she gives you the summaries online and you just take notes from those. Very easy class but shes also SO funny and kind. Easy to talk to and willing to help.

She is an amazing professor! Not only does she make class fun, she gives you ample opportunity to make a high A in the class, and gives advice (Take it!!!!) on how to make a high A in the class. Hilarious and intelligent :)
Easiest class of my college career. Very nice woman too.
Amazing teacher, super nice and understanding. The assignments are easy and so are the tests. You should make an A at the end of the year.

She is a great teacher and you barely have to put in effort to pass the class. Beware of online quizzes: they are tough and are weirdly worded. Tests are easy with 10 questions each. There was one extremely easy project. She is very understanding and wants to help you. 10/10 would recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Tests? Not many--Would take again

comment: Dr. Jackson is an incredibly fun and easy teacher. She doesn't take herself or her class too seriously. Being an introductory Sociology class she knows most of us are there to get an A and get out. Class is cancelled often and tests are short and simple. I highly recommend taking this class.
